title: The FBI is looking into threats against Colorado justices after Trump ballot ruling
description: The involvement of law enforcement comes amid a wave of threats against the justices who ruled this week that Trump is ineligible for the state's primary ballot.

title: Wisconsin Supreme Court rules GOP-drawn state legislative maps are unconstitutional
description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court ruled the Republican-drawn state legislative maps were unconstitutional, ordering lawmakers draw new lines for the 2024 elections.

title: Seattle hospital says Texas AG asked for records about transgender care for children
description: Texas AG Ken Paxton asked a Seattle hospital to hand over records regarding gender-affirming treatment potentially given to children from Texas, court filings show.

title: U.S. engine maker facing largest Clean Air Act penalty ever over emissions test cheating accusations
description: Engine manufacturer Cummins Inc. has agreed to pay a $1.675 billion penalty for allegedly installing "defeat devices" on approximately 1 million pickup trucks to cheat emissions tests.

title: California man who fell into narrow 18-inch hole freed after 18-hour rescue mission
description: A man who slipped and fell into a narrow hole in the Sunset Cliffs area of San Diego County, California, was freed Friday following an 18-hour rescue mission.

title: Trump on 'poisoning the blood' remarks: 'I never knew that Hitler said it'
description: Donald Trump again defended his recent remarks about immigrants "poisoning the blood" of America, saying he never knew it was language Adolf Hitler used.

title: Supreme Court sidesteps decision on Trump presidential immunity claim in federal election interference case
description: The Supreme Court will not immediately decide whether former President Donald Trump has broad immunity for his actions challenging the 2020 presidential election results.

title: Why the 9-month Ultimate World Cruise is social media's latest obsession
description: It only took two weeks into a nine-month global cruise for it to go viral on TikTok. On TikTok, the #UltimateWorldCruise tag has more than 54.8 million views.

title: Four teens sue San Francisco and police chief over mass arrest of youths at 'Hill Bomb' skateboarding event
description: Every year, throngs of youths descend upon San Francisco’s Mission District for a skateboarding event, but this year festivities ended in chaos with police arresting over 100 young people — some as young as 13 — and leaving them in the streets with no food, water or chance to use the bathroom for hours, a new lawsuit claim.

title: Tesla recalls 120,000 vehicles over potentially faulty doors that could open in a crash
description: Tesla is recalling Tesla Model S luxury sedans and Model X SUVs manufactured in 2022 and 2023 due to the vehicles’ failure to comply with U.S. government regulations.

title: A Mississippi mother alleges police shot ‘blindly’ into a car and hit her in the head
description: Sherita Harris, a mother of five, says Mississippi Capitol Police shot “blindly” into a car she was riding in during a chase in Jackson, striking her in the head.

title: Neighbor accused of assaulting actor Charlie Sheen at his Malibu home
description: A neighbor forced her way into the Southern California home of "Two and a Half Men" actor Charlie Sheen and attacked him, authorities said Friday.

title: Ron DeSantis' super PAC cancels remaining ad reservations as another group aims to fills the void
description: Never Back Down, a super PAC backing Ron DeSantis in the 2024 Republican presidential primary, canceled ad reservations in Iowa and New Hampshire.

title: Prices finally fell last month after 3.5 years of increases
description: New government data showed prices notching a monthly decline for the first time since April 2020, adding to an improving picture on inflation as the new year looms.

title: Five new species of fuzzy hedgehogs are discovered in Southeast Asia
description: Scientists identified five new species of soft-furred hedgehogs in Southeast Asia.

title: Ohio woman is charged after miscarrying in her bathroom. Experts warn of a dangerous precedent.
description: A Black woman in Ohio has been charged with a felony for abuse of a corpse after she miscarried into her toilet, according to a criminal complaint, and reproductive rights experts are warning that it could set a dangerous precedent if she is convicted.

title: Massachusetts police chief apologizes after middle school searched for LGBTQ book with 'concerning illustrations'
description: A Massachusetts police chief apologized after an officer searched a middle school for a copy of "Gender Queer: A Memoir," an illustrated book on gender identity that has been banned in other districts.

title: Ron DeSantis spread false information while pushing trans health care ban, judge says
description: Florida's transgender health care ban was sold as defending kids from mutilation when it is actually about preventing trans minors from getting care, the judge said.

title: Pornhub owner agrees to pay $1.8M and independent monitor to resolve sex trafficking-related charge
description: The owner of Pornhub, one of the world’s largest adult content websites, has admitted to profiting from sex trafficking and agreed to make payments to women whose videos were posted without their consent, federal prosecutors in New York announced Thursday.

title: ICE is sending more people to a troubled Louisiana detention center, advocates say
description: Dozens of migrants have recently been transferred to the Winn federal detention center in Louisiana that has been the subject of years of complaints, advocates said.

title: Under new FDA rules, a gay blood center employee donated for the first time
description: Thanks to new federal guidelines finalized in May, gay and bisexual men in monogamous relationships can now donate at many blood centers around the country.

title: Trump was recorded pressuring two Michigan GOP canvassers not to certify 2020 election results
description: Donald Trump pressured two Republican canvassers in Michigan not to certify the 2020 presidential election results in a phone call days after the election, The Detroit News reported, citing recordings of the call that it had reviewed.

title: From ‘Blackouts’ to ‘Page Boy,’ the best LGBTQ books of 2023
description: This year's best LGBTQ books include Blackouts, Page Boy, Couplets, Big Swiss, Family Meal, Lush Lives, Moby Dyke, Mrs. S and Ponyboy.

title: 5 takeaways from NBC News' yearlong investigation into deadly consumer products
description: Popular products that pose a threat to children can remain on the market for years. This is how hurdles at the Consumer Product Safety Commission have delayed rules.

title: Biden to issue pardons for certain marijuana offenses
description: The president will also commute the sentences of 11 people convicted of nonviolent drug offenses, the White House said.

title: What to expect as drivers hit the road for the holidays
description: More than 100 million Americans are expected to hit the road this holiday season, with Friday and Saturday seeing some of the busiest traffic conditions. NBC’s Shaquille Brewster reports for TODAY.

title: Senate border negotiations on hold and Hamas reportedly refuses weeklong cease-fire: Morning Rundown
description: As Ukraine's frontline gains slow, Kyiv turns to sabotage.

title: With holiday travel in full swing, what to expect at the airports
description: With three days to go until Christmas, the holiday rush at airports is in full swing. NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY on what travelers can expect during one of the busiest days of the season.

title: After authorizing their inquiry, Republicans could slow-walk a Biden impeachment vote
description: House Republicans have authorized their impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden but it's unclear when — or if — they'll hold a vote to force a Senate trial.

title: How the White House convinced Israel to open another crossing for aid to enter Gaza
description: When the temporary truce between Israel and Hamas collapsed earlier this month, the Biden administration’s immediate concerns were twofold: the fate of the remaining hostages in Gaza and the effect the resumption of fighting would have on the ability to get humanitarian assistance to the Palestinian people.

title: Convoy of hearses leaves Prague university as Czech Republic reels from its worst-ever mass shooting
description: The Czech Republic woke up to a line of hearses emerging from a university in the capital, as the country reeled from its worst-ever mass shooting.

title: Biden's Ukraine aid deadline falls prey to rapidly shifting U.S. immigration politics
description: The ongoing immigration talks between President Joe Biden and Republican and Democratic senators highlight the tricky ground he's on going into the 2024 election.

title: Ukraine likely to ramp up sabotage inside Russia in the new year
description: Facing battlefield stalemate and flagging Western support, Ukraine will likely ratchet up sabotage inside Russia to raise the cost of Moscow’s war effort, officials and experts say.

title: Hamas reportedly rejects weeklong cease-fire offer
description: Hamas reportedly rejects weeklong cease-fire offer

title: From movie icons to pioneering political figures: Legendary Latinos we lost in 2023
description: We remember Latinos who died in 2023, including Hollywood icon Raquel Welch, Hispanic statesman Bill Richardson, baseball legend Willie Hernández and pioneering Latina politician Gloria Molina.

title: Jan. 6 rioters the far right claimed were antifa keep getting unmasked as Trump supporters
description: After the Capitol riot on January 6, conspiracy theorists began suggesting that antifa activists or federal agents dressed as Trump supporters carried out the attacks.

title: Here's who has Trump's ear as the primary season kicks into full gear
description: As Trump consolidates support for the Republican nomination, the many conservative advisers who orbited him while he was president are turning up again.

title: Former Trump aide asks judge to dismiss Hunter Biden lawsuit tied to laptop
description: Hunter Biden had sued Garrett Ziegler and his company, claiming they broke the law in an effort to create an online database with emails attributed to Biden.

title: Two 10-year-old boys killed after father flees from Wisconsin deputies, officials say
description: Two 10-year-old Wisconsin boys were killed after their father sped away from a traffic stop, was chased and then crashed late Wednesday, the Waukesha County Sheriff’s Department said.

title: Body found in trunk of burning car in California
description: A body was found inside a trunk of a burning vehicle in California on Wednesday, authorities said.

title: Norwegian cruise ship loses ability to navigate after rogue wave hits
description: A Norwegian cruise ship lost the ability to navigate after a rogue wave crashed into the vessel on Thursday, cruise company HX said in a statement.

title: Lawsuit alleges Vin Diesel sexually assaulted his assistant in 2010
description: A former assistant accuses actor Vin Diesel of sexually assaulting her in an Atlanta hotel in 2010, according to a lawsuit filed Thursday.

title: Two men charged in fight that preceded Patriot's fan's death at Gillette Stadium
description: Two men have been charged in connection with a fight this year at a New England Patriots game that preceded the death of another man who was involved, prosecutors said.

title: Man charged with threatening to kill Vivek Ramaswamy is indicted over threats to other candidates
description: Prosecutors say Tyler Anderson of N.H. threatened to “impale” and “disembowel” a presidential candidate, while making similar threats to other White House hopefuls.

title: FDA warns about fake versions of Ozempic diabetes drug after seizing thousands of counterfeit injections
description: The FDA on Thursday warned consumers not to use counterfeit versions of Novo Nordisk's diabetes drug Ozempic that have been found in the U.S. drug supply chain.

title: 440 kids have died from window covering cords over 50 years. Why has change been so slow?
description: An NBC News analysis found that at least 440 children have been strangled to death over the last 50 years by window covering cords, like blinds, shades and curtains. Attempts to address the danger have faced challenges and delays. NBC News’ Vicky Nguyen speaks to impacted parents and the Consumer Product Safety Commission chair.
